context: Jesus made clear that a special kind of love would identify his followers. Jesus says:"My command is this: love each other as I have loved you.." This is self-sacrificing love moves a Christian even to die for a fellow believer if necessary.

I don't know much with certainty. I try to be open minded. I think can be done here too. Take care fellow humans and remember J "My command is this: love each other as I have loved you" Jesus, God's son or not, was a good man no doubt.

"My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you." A command is an authoritative order and a commandment is an authoritative rule. Loving our enemies is not a choice but it's an order and secondly just as Christ loved us we ought to love others.

I'm sad that you feel that Christianity is represented by a couple of holidays. Jesus Christ should live within his followers & their actions everyday. "My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you." I'm pretty sure he meant everybody, including LBGTQ+.
Jesus is Love and commands you to love others...My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.
My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. I don't think hating trans or gay people is very just, holy, or righteous. It does however, show obsession with hate.

We need a special day to celebrate the many loving caregivers who support their loved ones with #cancer + other illnesses. "My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. Greater love has no one than this, that one lay down his life for his friends."

Spot on! Haters are great at labeling their fears.. Why not do like what the central figure in their religion did (Jesus) - accepted people for what they were and love others, not hate them. "My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you."

My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.. Jesus calls on all of us to engage in loving others, just as He has loved us. This is one of the Bible verses that makes it clear that God's love is the blueprint to follow in our own lives
"My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you." Love others with your care, kindness, acceptance, forgiveness, patience, and service.

My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. ‚ù§Ô∏è God is Love. Don't let another day go by being angry with someone else: KNOW THAT GOD LOVES EVERYTHING. THE WORLD IS HIS. When you love other, other will love you.

"My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you." Jesus showed dignity, respect, and support to the dregs of society throughout his ministry, so a command to love others the way he has loved them obviously asserts that.
The Sacred Heart of Jesus is a good time to remember that Jesus preached us to love others, not hate them. "My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you."

My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. As true Christians we should love the People that in the LGBTQIA. We don't have to support it but love them as there are people too. And be loving to blacks and whites and Mexican and Asian and other culture

My COMMAND is this: Love each other as I have loved you. Jesus didn't say just whites. Means every race, gender & sexual orientation. Jesus supports #Diversity.

We are not complete in CHRIST unless we love one another as CHRIST has loved us. When we do this, as CHRIST has given us commandment, we shall give evidence that we are complete in HIM. My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.

"My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you."The Bible commands Christians to love others ‚Äî even LGBTQ members ‚Äî as Christ loves us. It's important to remember that to love others doesn't equate to validating their lifestyle.
"My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you." Read the bible first before trying to oppress an LGBTQ group that's already been fighting for freedom and acceptance for so long.

Followers of Christ loves on the principle of grace and not on the merit of the person loved. This is love without limits. Love God. Love others. My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you.
It is not our place to judge. When our day of judgement comes it won't be man judging man. It will be Christ judging man, Jesus tells us "My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you."

My command is this: Love each other as I have loved you. So many verses on LOVE. I haven't read where it tells anyone to be homophobic & hate others.
